title: Angelina Jolie stuns in hot pink gown in Cambodia during promotional tour
text:

Angelina Jolie has continued her promotional tour in Cambodia as she stepped out in a gorgeous hot-pink gown. 
The star has been abroad promoting her latest project - with all six of her children joining her for the world premiere - and the first screenings of First They Killed My Father. 
She was seen as a ceremony at the Angkor temple complex in Siem Reap province on Saturday, and looking amazing in the bold dress and diamond earrings as she was being honoured for her work on the film. Angelina Jolie met Cambodian King Norodom Sihamoni (Photo: REUTERS) She was honoured at the opening ceremony of the film (Photo: REUTERS) 
This week marked the actress’ first red carpet appearance since her split from Brad Pitt last year, and it was the first time she’s made a public appearance with all of her children without him. 
While Zahara wore a loose dress and Vivienne opted for a jumpsuit, Maddox, Pax and Knox all wore smart suits, as did tomboy Shiloh. Angelina Jolie and her children at the movie's Cambodian premiere (Photo: PAOLO STAGNARO/NETFLIX) From l-r: Shiloh, Pax, Knox, Vivienne, Zahara and Maddox (Photo: PAOLO STAGNARO/NETFLIX) The kids looked in good spirits outside the prmeiere (Photo: Coleman-Rayner) Read More Angelina Jolie returns to spotlight after Brad Pitt split to promote Netflix movie in Cambodia 
In a 2010 interview with Vanity Fair, Angelina said: "Shiloh, we feel has Montenegro style. It's how people dress there. She likes tracksuits, she likes [regular] suits. So it's a suit with a tie and a jacket and slacks, or a tracksuit. She likes to dress like a boy. She wants to be a boy. So we had to cut her hair. She likes to wear boys' everything. She thinks she's one of the brothers." 
Angelina flew to Cambodia with her children for the premiere of her new Netflix movie, based on the memoirs of Loung Ung, whose family were victims to the Khmer Rouge regime. 
Ahead of the red carpet, Angelina, 41, attended a photocell and press conference, where she spoke about filming the movie in Cambodia and how she wanted to understand what eldest son Maddox’s family had been through. 
She adopted Maddox from a Cambodian orphanage in 2002. Hollywood star Angelina Jolie greets media during a press conference (Photo: Getty) Hollywood star Angelina filmed the movie last year (Photo: Getty) Read More Angelina Jolie slams Donald Trump's travel ban - 'Our response should be based on facts, not fear' 
“It helped to open my eyes to what was going on the world. I wanted to tell the story to through the eyes of the child’s point of view, the love of a family, to show the beauty of the country and understand what Maddox’s parents may have gone through,” she told reporters, according to People. 
It was Maddox who was instrumental in getting the memoirs to screen, as Angelina recalled in a recent interview with The Guardian. 
“He was the one who just called it and said he was ready and that he wanted to work on it, which he did. He read the script, helped with notes, and was in the production meetings," said Angelina.
